column1: Art Institute of Chicago////The piece de resistance of the Art Institute is Georges Seurat's Sunday Afternoon on the Island of La Grande Jatte
column2: featured most prominently in Ferris Bueller's Day Off. It's conveniently also one of my favorite paintings
column3: and is worth the price of admission alone. The pointillism
column5: and stark upclose/faraway contrast be described by words but only marveled upon in person.
